page.title: 02DRUGS
page.content: DRUG ABUSE IS A GROWING PROBLEM AMONG YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE GREENOCK-GOUROCK AREA.A WIDE RANGE OF DRUGS IS BEING USED-FROM SOFT DRUGS LIKE VALLIUM AND 'GRASS' TO HARD DRUGS LIKE P.C.P. (ANGEL DUST) AND HEROIN.THE AVERAGE AGE OF ADDICTS IS FROM 22-31.THE PUSHERS CUT HEROIN WITH GLUCOSE OR FLOUR.AT THE MOMENT HEROIN IS VERY CHEAP-0.02 OF A GRAM COSTS Â£10.PEOPLE BUY HEROIN IN EITHER Â£10 OR Â£20 BAGS. WHEN THE HEROIN IS BOUGHT IT IS 91% PURE,BUT BY THE TIME IT REACHES THE STREET IT IS 28% PURE.THE AUTHORITIES HAVE NOT BEEN SLOW TO RECOGNISE THIS PROBLEM,AND A REHABILITATION CENTRE FOR ADDICTS HAS BEEN SET UP AT RAVENSCRAIG HOSPITAL.THE SOCIAL WORK DEPARTMENT ALSO TRIES TO HELP ADDICTS WITH THEIR MANY PROBLEMS.
